intro: Ribes pneobalsamum, commonly known as the alpine gooseberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Grossulariaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in the Pamir and Tien Shan ranges. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and edible berries that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
